results.title: Bright eyes
results.creator_credit: Sol Wurtzel, David Butler and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Shirley Temple collection”.
The first big film created especially for her, ‘Bright eyes’ helped make Shirley Temple a huge box-office star and features her most famous song, ‘On the good ship Lollipop’. The little darling of a group of aviators, Shirley splits her time between her pilot Godfather, Loop and her long-suffering mother who is a housemaid for a selfish, wealthy family. When a tragic accident suddenly leaves Shirley orphaned, Loop sets out to adopt Shirley - until he learns that he is not the only one determined to keep the adorable youngster. This is a colourized version of the original black and white film.

results.title: Brigadoon
results.brief_description: The magical world of Brigadoon casts a spell in this exuberant Scottish village that rises out of the Highland mists for just one day in every century. Gene Kelly and Van Johnson star as two jaded New Yorkers who come to Scotland on a hunting expedition and stumble upon the elusive 18th century village. There Kelly falls in love with Brigadoon’s prettiest lass, Fiona, played by Cyd Charisse, and he must decide whether to stay with her forever or return to civilisation. Rating: G

results.title: Briefing for health
results.brief_description: Indicates the dangers facing the female recruit when she joins the W.A.A.F. The ravages of venereal diseases are illustrated, with information on the avoidance of the disease and on measures to be taken if it is suspected that the disease has been contacted. No other credits available.

results.title: Briefing
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film Corporation and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working together”.
Discussion starter looking at the problem of an individual receiving information from a group. Three executives are briefing a new designer and digress to such an extent that at the end of the briefing the designer still has to ask what the product was. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Brief encounter [study extract]
results.brief_description: An extract from “Brief encounter” directed by David Lean. An ordinary suburban housewife, and a young married doctor, meet casually, fall deeply in love, but realises family ties do not permit their passion so they part. In the extract Laura and Alec spend their last day together before he goes to South Africa. They part where they met - in the station buffet. Their last moments are shattered by the arrival of a talkative friend of Laura’s. In despair she almost commits suicide but reason prevails and she returns to her husband. The extract is dominated by the heavy atmosphere of the railway station, the emotional dialogue and the climax of the suicide attempt.

results.title: Brief encounter
results.creator_credit: Noel Coward, Cineguild and David Lean
results.brief_description: Dr. Alex Harvey (Trevor Howard) and Laura Jesson (Celia Johnson) meet at a railway station and fall in love. Married to other people in middle-class suburban England, they nevertheless maintain an acquaintanceship on her shopping trips to town which deepens into a friendship which blossoms into forbidden love. This is the original screen version of Noel Coward’s one act play, “Still Life”. Atmospherically directed by David Lean, “Brief Encounter” is an evergreen romance classic of post-war English cinema with seamless performances from the leading actors and an excellent music score borrowing heavily from Rachmaninoff. The screenplay was also written by Noel Coward.

results.title: Brief city: the story of London's festival buildings
results.creator_credit: Richard Massingham, Massingham Productions, Maurice Harvey and Jacques Brunius
results.brief_description: A tour of inspection of the Festival of Britain South Bank Exhibition photographed during the last ten days of the Exhibition. Emphasis is placed on the architecture of the Exhibition, explaining why it was planned as a “giant toyshop”, why it was given no processional vista, and how the Exhibition was regarded as an experiment in modern building and architecture.

results.title: Bridgit
results.brief_description: The 32 minute work by Scottish artist Charlotte Prodger won the 2018 Turner Prize, and explores themes of class, gender, sexuality and neolithic goddesses.

constellations_other.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.title: Bridging the learning gap
results.creator_credit: University of New South Wales. Tertiary Education Research Centre and George Pashuk
results.brief_description: Discusses the use of small discussion groups as the main teaching medium in the University’s Faculty of Law, and reasons for the adoption of the system. The role of the teacher in this teaching situation, and the extent to which objectives are being achieved are being evaluated by the T.E.R.C. Increasing student interest and involvement is apparent.
